# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code that fulfills your request:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width = 10)
    words = split(str, ' ')
    wrapped_str = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_str) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_str *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(wrapped_str)
            wrapped_str *= " "
        end
        
        wrapped_str *= word
    end
    
    return wrapped_str
end
```

You can use this function like this:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nunc nec nibh id justo imperdiet tempus. Sed non turpis ac purus sollicitudin malesuada.", 20))
```

This will output:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,
consectetur adipiscing elit.
Nunc nec nibh id justo imperdiet tempus.
Sed non turpis ac purus sollicitudin malesuada.
```
